alert.note: Alert for Cass; Mason (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 1:43PM CST until January 31 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Sangamon River near Chandlerville affecting Cass and Mason Counties. .The ice jam has moved further downstream away from Chandlerville, allowing the river to fall into minor flood stage. Additional fluctuations in water levels remain possible, with flows expected to remain elevated over the next few days due to recent rainfall and snow melt. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sangamon River near Chandlerville. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 459.9 feet, Flooding begins to impact some residences in Chandlerville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CST Saturday the stage was 458.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 PM CST Saturday was 459.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday evening and continue falling to 454.0 feet Saturday, February 03. - Flood stage is 456.6 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Sangamon River Chandlerville 456.6 458.1 Sat 1 pm CST 457.0 456.9 456.7 &&
info.instruction: Persons with interests along this river need to remain aware of the latest forecasts and associated flood risk for their area. Stay tuned for further updates on this flooding situation. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
